intro: Gymnosporia antunesii, commonly known as the Antunes' burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. Gymnosporia antunesii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
